title: Trinny and Susannah’s daughters say pair ‘would be cancelled’ if show made now
description: Lyla Elichaoff and Esme Bertelsen tell Tatler they have never watched What Not to Wear, with Elichaoff saying: ‘you can’t really speak to people like that now’Trinny and Susannah, the presenters of the noughties fashion TV hit What Not to Wear, would be cancelled if the show was made today, their daughters have said.Trinny Woodall and Susannah Constantine starred in the BBC fashion makeover series, in which they dispensed brutally honest style tips, between 2001 and 2007. Continue reading...

title: Frasers Group criticises management of Mulberry after ditching takeover plans
description: Mike Ashley’s retail group says it ‘remains concerned about governance’ at luxury brand after final bid rejectedMike Ashley’s Frasers Group has criticised the management of Mulberry as it walked away from its attempts to take over the luxury handbag maker after a series of rejected offers.Frasers, which is Mulberry’s second-largest shareholder with a 37% stake, had made several offers for the fashion brand, culminating in a £111m bid this week, all of which have been rebuffed. Continue reading...

title: Refinery29 Loves: Everything To See & Shop In October
description: Welcome to Refinery29 Loves, the monthly news bulletin where you’ll find the best things to shop and see in fashion and beauty right now.The recent spring/summer 2025 shows may have had brighter days in mind but the layering, structured outerwear, and bold prints we saw on the runways in New York, London, Milan, and Paris work just as well for fall.In London, Chopova Lowena showcased patterned tights alongside metal hardware and three-quarter-length, snake-print leather jackets. In New York, all eyes were on LaQuan Smith’s military-style shirts, translucent trench coats, and oxblood feathered jackets. And was there anyone who didn't go weak at the knees for Saint Laurent? The show in Paris brought back the brand founder’s famous tailored look with 1980s-style shoulder pads, polka dot ties, and heavy leather bomber jackets.When it came to beauty, Tolu Coker made the case for 1960s glamour at her London Fashion Week show, with models donning voluminous beehives and graphic black and white eyeliner with diffused corners. Harris Reed went one step further with full doll eyes complete with long, sticky lashes and warm, golden bronze eyeshadows. But it was perhaps Luar who best channeled the vampiness of the season with glossy black lips and exaggerated brows.If all that isn’t enough inspiration for the season ahead, we’ve got plenty of new launches on our radar which are sparking our imagination this October. To find out all the latest beauty products and fashion collections catching our attention, click through the slideshow ahead…All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.Ganni x Barbour Ganni and Barbour are back with their third collaboration in as many years. The collection is made up of nine pieces that reimagine the British heritage brand’s classic outerwear with Scandi twists — think: leopard-print waxed jackets with oversized corduroy collars, patchwork barn jackets, and belted trench coats. “This collection is all about celebrating friendship, our mutual shared community, and the beautiful blend of our two worlds,” Ganni creative director Ditte Reffstrup said, in a press release. Ganni x Barbour 3.0 will be available to shop online on October 30, with prices ranging from $130 to $645.Shop on October 30 at GanniReformation Drops First-Ever Jewelry Collection with Clare Waight KellerFor the first time ever, Reformation dropped a line of jewelry — and to do so, it partnered with former Givenchy head/current Uniqlo creative director Clare Waight Keller. The launch includes a selection of 1920s-Paris-inspired earrings, bracelets, and necklaces designed to feel both contemporary and heirloom-worthy, made with materials like recycled 24-karat gold vermeil and semi-precious stones. The Clare Waight Keller for Reformation jewelry collection is available to shop now, with prices ranging from $168 to $898.Shop now at ReformationReformation x Clare Waight Keller Gertrude Cuff, $, available at ReformationReformation x Clare Waight Keller Bechet Earring, $, available at ReformationEverlane’s Western Collection The Western trend is staying strong going into the last couple of months of 2024. The proof? Everlane’s Going Western collection, which aims to elevate the saloon look via a range of denim (including a ranch jacket, culottes, and a midi skirt), barrel pants, riding boots, and more that would fit right in at a ranch (or a “Cowboy Carter” listening party).Shop now at EverlaneEverlane The Midi Quilted Liner, $, available at EverlaneEverlane The Denim Culotte, $, available at EverlaneEverlane The Outlaw Boot, $, available at EverlaneJennifer Fisher Chavez Collection For the latest jewelry launch under her eponymous brand, Jennifer Fisher looked to celebrity stylist/personal friend Nicole Chavez (who has worked with stars like Kristen Bell and Rachel Bilson) for inspiration. The six-piece line evokes Chavez’s effortless style with two-tone jewelry (a first for the brand), including rounded rings, earrings, huggies, and an ear cuff. Shop now at Jennifer FisherJennifer Fisher Chavez Huggies, $, available at Jennifer FisherFilson x Birkenstock 1774 Filson and Birkenstock 1774 are celebrating their lasting legacies in a new collaboration that blends the American heritage brand’s rugged and rustic aesthetic with the German footwear label’s comfort-focused silhouettes. There are three styles: the Lahti, a soft, collapsible boot made in part with wool; the Skykomish, a utilitarian boot with oiled-cloth, leather, and rubber components; and the London Moccasin, a suede and leather slip-on adorned with a buckle. Prices range from $375 to $625. Shop now at BirkenstockBirkenstock 1774 x Filson Skykomish, $, available at BirkenstockLe Damier de Louis Vuitton Louis Vuitton’s iconic checkerboard Damier pattern has become synonymous with the French fashion house. Now, the luxury brand is aiming to capture that sense of history and timelessness in the Le Damier de Louis Vuitton fine jewelry collection, which boasts grids of alternating polished and diamond squares wrapped around rings, tennis bracelets, and earrings. All in all, there are 12 elegant pieces available in yellow and white gold.Shop now at Louis VuittonLouis Vuitton Le Damier de Louis Vuitton Small Ring, Yellow Gold and, $, available at Louis VuittonLouis Vuitton Le Damier de Louis Vuitton Small Bracelet, $, available at Louis VuittonGlossier You Rêve and You DouxThe original Glossier You eau de parfum became a viral sensation for smelling completely different on everyone. Now, the brand is bringing two new dreamy fragrances into the fold, this time with more distinctive personalities. Housed in a crushed grape-colored bottle, You Rêve is all about sweet warmth with notes including buttercream, toasted almond and plum butter alongside spicy sandalwood. For those in search of something less fruity, You Doux is the sophisticated older sister scent, offering a softer mix of notes. Blending earthy palo santo, frankincense and sweet violet, the perfume delivers a musky woodiness that’s perfect for fall. Both fragrances are vegan and cruelty-free.Shop now at GlossierGlossier Glossier You Rêve, $, available at GlossierUGG New Heights CollectionIt’s officially “boots with the fur” season, which makes UGG’s latest platform footwear perfectly timed. Featuring the brand’s first-ever heeled designs, the New Heights collection adds a touch of glamour to the everyday with a range of heel heights across classic and new silhouettes. The stand-out for sure is the Xtra Boot, a full suede, knee-high design that we wouldn’t be shocked to see Sabrina Carpenter wearing on her upcoming Christmas special. If you’re searching for something more subtle, there’s also an ultra mini low boot with a 1.5" heel height and a range of heeled cozy clogs in neutral colorways that could rival the Tasman’s popularity. Catch us looking cozy (and tall) in this collection throughout fall.Shop now at UGGUgg New Heights Platform Xtra, $, available at UggBebe x CiaraDespite being a nostalgic brand for many, Bebe continues to be discovered by new generations: The label is currently all over TikTok thanks to its diamanté Y2K spaghetti tops and fitted hoodies. It continues to innovate, this season tapping pop/R&B icon Ciara as creative director for a capsule collection. While many of the looks are ready for center stage (the leopard-print catsuit is giving serious Scary Spice vibes), there are plenty of casual date-night pieces. However, if what you want this season is to be toasty and talked about, look no further than the head-turning, faux-fur olive maxi coat.Shop now at BebeBebe x Ciara Faux Fur Maxi Coat, $, available at bebeDr Dennis Gross DermInfusions Blur + Repair CreamWe all know that colder weather can lead to dry, inflamed skin, which is why a nourishing moisturizer is a must come autumn. Luckily, dermatologist Dr Dennis Gross has expanded the DermInfusions line just in time for the mercury to drop, launching a new Blur and Repair Cream that delivers serious hydration. Containing rich shea butter and skin barrier-boosting ceramides, the cream aims to improve elasticity while hydrating hyaluronic acid and skin-strengthening peptides draw in moisture, leaving a plump and glowing base for makeup application. The formula is non-comedogenic, too, so it’s less likely to cause breakouts.Shop now at SephoraDr. Dennis Gross DermInfusions™ Blur + Repair Cream, $, available at SephoraDaily Paper x ConverseDaily Paper, which started out in Amsterdam in 2012, celebrates African culture through its luxurious pieces boasting monogram prints. This October, the label is collaborating with footwear giant Converse on a range of unisex sneakers and clothing, the most eye-catching of which has to be the playful Chuck 70s featuring black logo embroidery, contrast multicolored stitching, and interchangeable laces available in red, yellow, and green. Those searching for something more stealthy might enjoy the Chuck 70 De Luxe Squared, with its all-black snub-toe silhouette and brightly colored bottoms; those wanting something more snuggly should check out the logo fleece hoodie and sweatpants. Shop now at ConverseConverse x Daily Paper Chuck 70 Sneakers, $, available at ConverseGU x Rokh Just weeks after launching in the US, Uniqlo’s sister brand GU is making another splash in the fashion scene by dropping a collab with former H&M collaborator Rokh. The 16-piece collection experiments with tailoring and layering through fall-ready pieces like quilted jackets, skirts over pants, sweaters with armholes, and a combo bustier/button-front top. Gu x Rokh will be available to shop on October 18, with prices ranging from $29.90 to $99.90.Shop on October 18 at GUGu x Rokh Striped Sailor Collar Sweater, $, available at GUGu x Rokh Hoodie Scarf, $, available at GUGu x Rokh 2 Piece Skirt And Pants Set Checked, $, available at GUGu x Rokh Mary Jane Shoes, $, available at GUStarface Hydro-Star Recovery PatchThe main benefit of a pimple patch is to gently draw out gunk; generally speaking, they do very little to reduce the angry redness that often accompanies an acne breakout. That’s where Starface’s new recovery patches enter the picture. While the brand’s famous yellow stars aim to shrink spots, the new purple patches are designed to soothe inflammation after an (ill-advised) picking sesh. Containing soothing aloe vera and vitamin A to promote cell turnover, the recovery stars are all about bringing down redness fast. With the addition of licorice root to help with scarring, these patches put in the work to heal skin and get rid of the evidence.Shop now at StarfaceStarface hydro-star® recovery, $, available at StarfacePleasing x Disney Fantasia Revel in the nostalgic magic of the 1940s animated classic Fantasia with Pleasing’s latest collaboration. The Harry Styles-backed brand has partnered with Disney on a line of apparel, accessories, and beauty products inspired by the film. Find three nail polish sets (each of which borrows cues from different segments of the movie), a new edition of the Big Lip HA Moisture Balm, hoodies, tote bags, and more. “When visiting the Disney archives, we had the opportunity to look through lots of archived and special illustrations which was very exciting — especially as a child who went to the Disney parks — getting a peek behind the curtains of how these beautiful movies and moments are made felt truly inspiring,” Pleasing creative director Harry Lambert said, in a press release. “From very early on, Fantasia was always in the front of our minds at Pleasing; the aesthetics, the mood, the bold illustrations, the colors, and, ultimately, the epic world that Disney has created, were very much a world that resonated with Pleasing.” Prices range from $25 to $289.Shop now at PleasingPleasing x Disney Fantasia L’Apprenti Sorcier Tote in Blue, $, available at PleasingREFY Plum Lip CollectionThe onset of autumn might have some people thinking of sunset-colored trees, cinnamon drinks, and baked pumpkin goods; for us, it’s all about the arrival of vampy makeup. A wine-stained lip is arguably the most sophisticated makeup trend for this time of year and REFY is joining the party with a brand-new, plum-hued lip combo. Comprising a dome-shaped Blur Liner and tinted lip gloss, the kit lends a plummy ombre effect that can be diffused by day and built up for a statement look come cocktail hour. Shop now at REFYREFY Plum Lip Collection, $, available at REFYCharlotte Simone Winter DropBritish designer Charlotte Simone has been known for her It-girl coats for quite some time. Taking inspiration from 1970s silhouettes, her Penny Lane-style jackets with flamboyant fluffy collars and larger-than-life shearling cuffs have been seen on everyone from Dua Lipa to Charli XCX to Florence Pugh. This autumn, the label is offering a sleeveless faux-suede vest, leather bomber and leopard-print Mongolian lambswool coat. If you aren’t ready to go full Almost Famous, the latest drop also includes some shaggy ombre scarves to liven up just about any layer.Shop now at Charlotte SimoneCharlotte Simone Naomi, $, available at Charlotte SimoneLike what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Refinery29 Loves: What To See & Shop In SeptemberDiesel & Savage X Fenty Collab Has Denim LingerieThis Cos Collection Is Peak Fall Dressing
author: Alicia Lansom

title: Christopher John Rogers x J.Crew Will Make You Want To Play Dress Up
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. What happens when you put together a classic American retailer with a bold, color-loving, award-winning designer? Well, you get a magical collection. That’s what J.Crew and Christopher John Rogers have done, with a limited-edition capsule full of timeless pieces with playful twists.Today, the Refinery29 reader-favorite retailer dropped its womenswear and childrenswear collaboration with Rogers, the CFDA’s 2020 Emerging Designer and 2021 American Womenswear Designer of the Year. It features eclectic-yet-wearable fall styles that promise to stand out from your wardrobe staples, infused with his brand’s signature stripes (on sweaters and suiting) and playful approach to color. Each piece feels special and luxurious, and priced between $98 and $550.Read on to learn more about the Christopher John Rogers x J.Crew collection and to shop pieces before they inevitably sell out quicker that you can gasp: “Gold lamé barn jacket!?” DashDividers_1_500x100 CJR x J.Crew Dresses Oh, what it would be like to strut in a Christopher John Rogers dress… Oh, wait, we can! The collection includes a range of sweater dresses and maxi shirt dresses for the office, as well as dazzling evening dresses for holiday parties.  DashDividers_1_500x100 CJR x J.Crew Matching Separates Pink and red and purple, oh my! Embrace color with this collection’s matching separates for a bold monochromatic look. Whether you opt for a sparkling three-piece suit, vinyl bustier skirt set, or a striped sweater and pleated skirt combo, there’s no doubt you’ll have heads turning.  DashDividers_1_500x100 CJR x J.Crew Outerwear Top off your fall and winter looks with a statement topcoat, blazer, or hoodie. Have you been wanting to try barn jackets? How about a bold gold one? Or, elevate your cozy-season loungewear game with a sequined hoodie? Either way, Christopher John Rogers and J.Crew promise to bundle you up in the chicest way possible. Shop full Christopher John Rogers x J.Crew collaboration Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Revamp Your Closet With New Massimo Dutti CapsuleZara’s Fall Collection Is Full Of TrendsBéis Is Launching A Wicked Luggage Collaboration

title: Shop Free People's Best Holiday Gifts - From Scrunchies to Lip Balms
description: Free People is one of our favorite retailers thanks to its wide selection of products - which includes everything from cozy wardrobe essentials to practical fitness gear and even coveted beauty products. We love it year-round, but during the holiday season, the brand transforms into a haven for gifting inspiration. Whether you're looking for a fashion gift for the stylish woman in your life, a cool piece of equipment that'll elevate anyone's workout game, or a unique gift that's sure to impress even the pickiest of recipients, there's something for everyone on your holiday shopping list - regardless of their product preferences (or your own personal budget). One of Free People's best features for narrowing down the best holiday gifts is its Top Rated page, where the most-desired clothing and accessories reside. Most of these options are offered in upward of 15 different shades, ranging from vibrant tones to neutrals. Another Free People perk is the abundance of reviews; countless customers weigh in on the products they purchased, often comparing the products to other popular items on the site, so you can be sure you're purchasing something truly worthwhile. To help simplify your holiday shopping this year, we curated a guide to the best Free People gifts, with top-rated selects from categories like fashion, beauty, home, and fitness. Our favorite finds include a luxurious sleep mask, a star-shaped lighting fixture that's perfect for seasonal decorating, a snuggly blanket, and wrist weights that are perfect for embracing TikTok's cozy cardio trend. Keep reading to shop our picks for the best gifts from Free People. Looking for something specific? Browse through our categories below: Best Beauty Gifts From Free People Best Fashion Gifts From Free People Best Home Gifts From Free People Best Fitness Gifts From Free People Related: Our 2024 Holiday Gift Guide Has Arrived! Shop Gifting Ideas From PS Editors
author: Kyley Warren

title: 28 Stylish Picks We're Currently Eyeing From Abercrombie
description: Who would have thought that our closets would be filled with Abercrombie & Fitch again?! Abercrombie has long been famous for its expansive collection of flattering jeans, which are editor-loved. But recently, the retailer went through a little makeover of its own; long gone are the days of logo-filled graphic T-shirts and limited denim offerings, now the brand is a haven for all types of fashion-lovers - and sizes. It's the best place to shop for everything from stylish, elevated basics to vintage-inspired looks, seasonal trends, and even wedding-guest dresses. The brand is clearly back and better than ever, and if TikTok hasn't already convinced you to shop at Abercrombie, let us do that for you. From trendy tops and elevated dresses to comfortable, tailored bottoms, Abercrombie has become synonymous with effortlessly chic clothing. The brand carries everything you need for a fashion-forward closet. From classic denim to its flattering silhouettes and expanded size range, Abercrombie has something for everyone. Plus, if something doesn't fit quite right, or the color you've been eyeing is finally back in stock, the brand makes it convenient to file a return or exchange. Abercrombie & Fitch's Return Policy Abercrombie and Fitch has a return policy of 30 days from the date of the last shipment, as long as you have your receipt, invoice, or order confirmation. Returns received after the 30-day mark will be refunded in an e-gift card for merchandise credit. If you love a style but just need a different size or color, you can exchange it in store or online through this returns portal. Active Abercrombie & Fitch Promo Codes and Sales There are plenty of new additions in the brand's sale section. Plus, you can get free shipping when you spend $99 or more. We love browsing the site for the brand's newest arrivals and even scoring a deal or two on a few pieces. So we decided to make your life easier and rounded up our current favorite wardrobe essentials and dresses from Abercrombie, both new and on sale, so you know what's worth buying, especially for the fall. Check out our picks ahead. Shop Editor-Favorite Picks From Abercrombie & Fitch Shop Abercrombie & Fitch Dresses Shop Abercrombie & Fitch New Clothing Keep reading to shop our top picks from Abercrombie & Fitch. Related: 13 Abercrombie Jeans TikTok Is Obsessed With Right Now
